meanings.definition: To move by turning over and over
meanings.sent1: The cat rolls on the grass.
meanings.sent2: The ball rolls down the hill.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy rolls around in the mud.
meanings.sent4: The waves roll gently onto the shore.
meanings.sent5: The snowball rolls quickly down the slope.

meanings.sent1: She ate a delicious roll with butter.
meanings.sent2: The sandwich had a soft roll as the base.
meanings.sent3: The bakery sells fresh rolls every morning.
meanings.sent4: The dinner roll was warm and fluffy.
meanings.sent5: The waiter brought a basket of warm rolls to the table.

meanings.definition: A list of names or items
meanings.sent1: The teacher called out the roll to check attendance.
meanings.sent2: The roll of students' names was on the board.
meanings.sent3: The roll of ingredients needed for the recipe was long.
meanings.sent4: She checked the roll of guests invited to the party.
meanings.sent5: The roll of tasks for the day was written on the whiteboard.

meanings.definition: To make a deep, continuous sound
meanings.sent1: The thunder rolls in the distance.
meanings.sent2: The drums roll loudly during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The old truck engine rolls noisily down the street.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds roll ominously overhead.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the train rolling along the tracks filled the air.
